snippet: The state senator Deb Fischer, who defeated two heavily favored primary opponents, is considered a front-runner with a reputation for skillfully twisting colleagues’ arms.
abstract: Nebraska State Senator Deb Fischer, the Republican nominee for the state's soon-to-be vacant United States Senate seat, represents one of the Republican Party's best hopes in its effort to regain control of the Senate; Fischer is thought to be the frontrunner in a general election against Nebraska's once-favored son Bob Kerrey, who is hampered by the fact that he lived for many years in New York.
lead_paragraph: The state senator Deb Fischer, who defeated two heavily favored primary opponents, is considered a front-runner with a reputation for skillfully twisting colleagues’ arms.

headline.seo: Deb Fischer Is G.O.P.’s Best Bet in Nebraska Senate Race
headline.main: From Long Shot to G.O.P.’s Best Bet in Nebraska’s Senate Race
headline.print_headline: From Long Shot to G.O.P.’s Best Bet in Nebraska’s Senate Race
